cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 220 miles SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest tonight, then north-northwest across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and toward the west-central Florida peninsula, with the center aiming toward the Tampa Bay region mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast near or just south of Tampa Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch: Lower Florida Keys from Seven Mile Bridge southward to Key West, including the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Grand Cayman; Cuban provinces of Isla de Juventud, Pinar del Rio, and Artemisa.  Tropical Storm Warning: Cuban provinces of La Habana, Mayabeque, and Matanzas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from Naples northward through the Big Bend, including Tampa Bay; Florida Keys
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) becoming possible late Tuesday night; hurricane-force gusts possible at landfall Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge values not yet issued for Tampa Bay, but track and strengthening indicate potential for greater than 3 ft inundation in and around Tampa Bay at mid-week high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rainfall possible in west-central Florida with locally higher amounts, bringing risk of flash and urban flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous seas and swells in approach of the storm will disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations.
